title: Key drop frequency.
body:
The number of keys fragments we get is pretty fair, probably more than fair, seeming its all free, and you cant really complain about free stuff!

What I don't understand though, is the frequency of them.
Riot has explained that the more you get the harder they are to come across. Which makes sense in theory..

But _(speaking for myself)_ its not motivating when you get 6 fragments in a day, and then never see one for the next three weeks _(which was my april)_.

Why not just make them regular? So you still get the same amount of keys in a month, but have them more evenly spread. So you don't open 3 chests in the first week and then be bone dry until next month.

Now that it's may and the cycle begins again, I've only played like 3 games today and already got 2 fragments. So by the end of tomorrow ill have probably 2 chests opened, and then nada until June.

Maybe its better this way for people who don't play much? I dont know. 
But when you play as much as I do _(and I'm sure a lot of you as well)_, you power through all the key fragments in a single day and then theres none left for aaaages. 

Thoughts?
_(to be clear, I'm not talking about the number of fragments to be increased, just for them to be a little more evenly spaced out)_

replies.body:
The drop rate for key fragments is a curve, not a line. With each fragment you earn, the chance to earn your next one goes down slightly. This number resets roughly every thirty days after you earn your first key fragment.

We wanted to give players who didn't play as frequently a good drop rate for keys, without making it feel like farming was mandatory if you wanted keys.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide

E.g. A player shouldn't feel like they need to play a couple of games every day or week to get their monthly keys. If they just play when they can it should be a nice bonus each month.

Ok, so the curve drop rate **is** for players who cant play that often, I thought it might be.
That makes sence.

But it's still annoying for those of us who play 4+ hours a day, because after the first couple few days, your chance of getting another key has decreased so much that you have to wait for the reset day to get your next one.

Which means that hextech crafting is basically off-limits for 70% of the month, which is a shame. It feels like after the first few days (which are loaded with keys), you have nothing left to look forward to.

I dont suppose there can be a solution though, not without compromising the number of keys players with limited play time can earn. Oh well.
Thanks for the reply!

I mean, I kinda like saving up my keys for a while then opening a whole bunch of chests at once. It's more exciting that just opening one every now and again so I kinda like the drops being all around the same time tbh.

But hey, that's just me :P

Ah ok thats fair enough haha 
How many chests do you like saving up for before you open them?

Well I have way more chests than keys cause I don't play all that often anymore so usually I'll try and save up three or four keys and then smash it. Means I open em often enough to feel it but enough of them that it feels more worth it.

Herein lies the problem however.

As a student, I can only play during selected times of the year e.g. holidays, long weekend breaks etc.

So when I get a two week break, and grind 8-10 chests, but am only able get a few keys to open them, I am left with all these chests and feel like I am forced to spend money on keys, which is probably why I get so annoyed when people try to give the illusion to hextech that it is "free".

This curve, as you call it, is at a basic level a good idea. However, it doesn't work because the rate at which players receive chests is not the same as the rate that players earn key shards, thus forcing the player to either spend money on the system or grind for keys, the exact thing you are trying to avoid!

Maybe a better idea, would be that the rate a player recieves keys is constant (which is reasonably low), however when they earn a chest maybe the drop rate for keys increases over the next few games?

Although there has been no Riot statement on *how much* drop rate increases in a premade, they have confirmed that it does. 

A [user on Reddit estimated that the rate increased by as much as 5%](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4atwfj/hextech_key_fragment_drop_rate_statistics/) when playing in a 5man (not definitive, drop rate varies for each player).  

No difference in gamemodes AFAIK.

I've noticed I get more keys after a period of time eg. once a month I would spam league and get heaps of key drops like you said you noticed you started getting more keys this month already. Didn't Riot also say how if you party with friends you get higher chances of key drops? 

I don't think Riot would want us to play less to be honest hahaha. Don't they want us to play with our friends and queue up together, so if this is the case maybe increase the chances of key drops when we party up?
